sentences.en: Courage seems now to have deserted him. May it quickly reappear.
sentences.cn: 他现在似乎失去了勇气，但愿他能很快重新振作起来。

sentences.en: Driving again after his accident must have taken a lot of courage (= needed courage ) .
sentences.cn: 他出事故后再驾车肯定需要很大的勇气。

sentences.en: Every person stood to applaud his unforgettable act of courage.
sentences.cn: 所有人起立为他不可磨灭的英勇之举鼓掌。

sentences.en: Have the courage to be honest with yourself and about yourself.
sentences.cn: 要有勇气对自己坦诚，同时对别人也要开诚布公。

sentences.en: He always put his point of view with clarity and with courage.
sentences.cn: 他总是清楚而勇敢地提出自己的观点。

sentences.en: He showed great courage by admitting that he is an alcoholic.
sentences.cn: 他以极大的勇气承认自己酗酒。

sentences.en: His citation says he showed outstanding and exemplary courage.
sentences.cn: 颁给他的嘉奖令称他表现出非凡的勇气，堪为表率。

sentences.en: Hugo bore his illness with great courage and good humour.
sentences.cn: 雨果以巨大的勇气和良好的精神状态面对疾病。

sentences.en: I am not sure whether this was courage or pig-headedness.
sentences.cn: 我不能肯定这是一种勇气，还是一种固执。

sentences.en: It took me about two hours to pluck up courage to call.
sentences.cn: 我用了大约2个小时才鼓起勇气打电话。

sentences.en: Mona remains unshaken by her ordeal and is matter-of-fact about her courage.
sentences.cn: 莫娜不为她经历的这场磨难所动，对自己表现出的勇气也态度淡然。

sentences.en: She prayed now. "Lord, help me to find courage."
sentences.cn: 她马上祈祷道：“上帝呀，请赐我勇气吧。”

sentences.en: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.--Winston Churchill
sentences.cn: 成功不是终点，失败也并非末日，最重要的是继续前进的勇气。

sentences.en: Sue showed great courage throughout her illness.
sentences.cn: 休在生病期间表现出了极大的勇气。

sentences.en: The world was electrified by his courage and resistance.
sentences.cn: 世人为他的勇气和反抗精神震惊不已。

sentences.en: Their courage failed a few steps short and they came running back.
sentences.cn: 还差几步他们却胆怯了，又跑回来了。

sentences.en: Thinking back, I don't know how I had the courage.
sentences.cn: 现在回想起来，我都搞不清我当时哪来的那股勇气。

phrases.phrase: have the courage of one's convictions
phrases.tran_cn: （无视困难或非难）敢于按自己的信念（做）

phrases.phrase: pluck up (或 screw up 或 take) courage
take one's courage in both hands
phrases.tran_cn: 鼓起勇气去做；敢作敢为

trans.tran_en: the quality of being brave when you are facing a difficult or dangerous situation or when you are very ill
